thread.title: B-Sens' rookies ready for first taste of AHL
thread.title_full: B-Sens' rookies ready for first taste of AHL

title: B-Sens' rookies ready for first taste of AHL
text:
B-Sens' rookies ready for first taste of AHL 
By Travis Eldridge October 9, 2015 Updated Oct 9, 2015 at 12:32 AM EDT 
Binghamton, NY (WBNG Binghamton) For a couple of Binghamton Senators rookies, the start of this season means the start of a new test. 
Forwards Tobias Lindberg and Nick Paul both join the B-Sens this year from the OHL. 
WBNG E-News - Sign Up For Our Newsletter! 
Paul scored 37 goals and had 29 assists for North Bay in the Ontario Hockey League last year. Those were both career highs for Paul in his major junior career. 
Meanwhile, Lindberg is coming off his one and only year in the OHL. The former fourth-round pick scored 32 goals and added 46 assists playing for the OHL's Oshawa Generals. 
For both it'll be bit of a transition to play against bigger more physical players at the AHL level, but coach Luke Richardson is excited to see what they can do. 
"It'll be fun to see them play. They've shown some real signs of flash already and they're had some great success in the past, so we see no reason why that type of player with their type of passion as a hockey players and people," said Richardson. "They're going to want to do that same thing again and they'll rise to the occasion." 
"It has been a long process ever since I was a kid, but obviously these are the things that I strive for and the goals that I set for myself," said Paul. "Right now I've reached them and I've got to set my bar even higher. That is one thing I think I do well in is setting my goals high and trying to reach them the best that I can." 
That first game for the B-Sens on Saturday is at home against Albany. To submit a comment on this article, your email address is required. We respect your privacy and your email will not be visible to others nor will it be added to any email lists. Most Viewed
